Dont really know the answer to this, other than any drug that is water soluable can be diluted if you drink too much water.I just dont like the advice to drink heaps of water, because there is a flip side.What gets tricky is what is too much water.Drinking 2-3 Liters (2-3 quarts roughly. Cant be bothered doing the conversion) is different if you are drinking it in Florida in the middle of summer compared to drinking the same amount in New York in Winter.One could be too much and one not enough.So My advice would be to listen to your body and drink when thirsty but err on the side of less. Just dont go crazy with it, or you may well be flushing all them nasty/lovely drug away.Just a thoughtCS

You say you are ALWAYS thirsty, does this thirst mean that you are virtually holding a bottle of water over your mouth and that you cant get enough?  If so, check for diabetes.  If anyone is experiencing an unusual amount of thirst, this is the first sign of diabetes.
